description: Vegans and non-vegans will enjoy this twist on a traditional stuffing, where quinoa replaces the bread and butternut squash, celeriac and hazelnuts add the flavors of fall.
title: Vegetarian Thanksgiving: A Quinoa Stuffing
title_page: Vegetarian Thanksgiving: A Quinoa Stuffing - The New York Times
text:
Photo
Thanksgiving stuffing is a favorite tradition, but if it’s stuffed in the bird or made with meat-stock, it’s off limits to vegetarian and vegan diners.
Amber St. Peter of Long Beach, Calif., offers this fresh take on a traditional holiday stuffing that’s suitable for everyone at the table, including those who want to eat gluten-free. It uses quinoa instead of bread, while butternut squash, celeriac and hazelnuts capture the flavors of fall. Ms. St. Peter, a vegan, made the dish for her family and even the meat-eaters loved it.
“This dish actually impressed them,” she says. “It’s hearty without the bread or gluten, and flavorful without a bunch of processed ingredients. It was a crowd pleaser the first year, and will be a permanent fixture at our table for years to come.”
Squash and Celeriac Quinoa Stuffing : Vegans and non-vegans will enjoy this twist on a traditional stuffing, where quinoa replaces the bread and butternut squash, celeriac and hazelnuts add the flavors of fall.
